briefdescription.para: Scrambler ON/OFF: Context sensitive.
All be idents.
Flag for ANY backend.
Flag for the IOCTL backend.
Flag for the IOCTL + sysfs backend.
Flag for the IOCTL + sysfs + LBA backend.
Enumeration of cmd back-ends used by liblightnvm.
Single-plane.
Dual-plane (NVM_IO_DUAL_ACCESS)
Quad-plane (NVM_IO_QUAD_ACCESS)
Plane-mode access for IO.
Flags for device quirks.
Enumeration of pseudo meta mode.
Enumeration of device bounds.
Block is free AKA good.
Block is bad.
Block has grown bad.
Block has been marked by device side.
Block has been marked by host side.
Representation of valid values of bad-block-table states.
Obtain string representation of the given plane-mode.

parameterdescription.para: The plane-mode to obtain string representation of

simplesect.para: On success, string representation of the given plane-mode. On error, "UNKN".

briefdescription.para: Execute an user command on the given device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct to fill with lower-level result-codes

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

briefdescription.para: Execute an admin command on the given device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct to fill with lower-level result-codes

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

briefdescription.para: Execute a vector user command on the given device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct to fill with lower-level result-codes

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

briefdescription.para: Execute a vector admin command on the given device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to struct to fill with lower-level result-codes

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

briefdescription.para: Prints a text-representation of the given command.
Prints a textual presentation of the vuser par of the given command.

simplesect.para: the "major" version of the library
the "minor" version of the library
the "patch" version of the library

briefdescription.para: Prints version information about the library.
Prints a humanly readable description of given boundary mask.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, void *buf, size_t count, off_t offset)
memberdef.name: nvm_lba_pread

briefdescription.para: Read up to `count` bytes from the given `device` starting at the given `offset` into the given buffer starting at `buf`.

simplesect.para: This is equivalent to `pread`/`pwrite` except it takes the opaque `struct nvm_dev *` instead of a file descriptor

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, const void *buf, size_t count, off_t offset)
memberdef.name: nvm_lba_pwrite

briefdescription.para: Write up to `count` bytes from the buffer starting at `buf` to the given device `dev` at given `offset`.

simplesect.para: This is equivalent to `pread`/`pwrite` except it takes the opaque `struct nvm_dev *` instead of a file descriptor

briefdescription.para: Prints a humanly readable representation the given `struct nvm_ret`.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the `struct nvm_ret` to print

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, struct nvm_addr addr, struct nvm_ret *ret)
memberdef.name: nvm_bbt_get

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a bad block table from device.

parameterdescription.para: Address of the LUN to retrieve bad-block-table for
Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result

simplesect.para: On success, a pointer to the bad-block-table is returned. On error, NULL is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, const struct nvm_bbt *bbt, struct nvm_ret *ret)
memberdef.name: nvm_bbt_set

briefdescription.para: Updates the bad-block-table on given device using the provided bbt.

parameterdescription.para: The bbt to write to device
Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, struct nvm_addr addrs[], int naddrs, uint16_t flags, struct nvm_ret *ret)
memberdef.name: nvm_bbt_mark

briefdescription.para: Mark addresses good, bad, or host-bad.

simplesect.para: The addresses given to this function are interpreted as block addresses, in contrast to `nvm_addr_write`, and `nvm_addr_read` which interpret addresses and sector addresses.
`enum nvm_bbt_state`

parameterdescription.para: 0x0 = GOOD, 0x1 = BAD, 0x2 = GROWN_BAD, as well as access mode
Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result.

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, struct nvm_addr addr, struct nvm_ret *ret)
memberdef.name: nvm_bbt_flush

briefdescription.para: Persist the bad-block-table at `addr` on device and deallocate managed memory for the given bad-block-table describing the LUN at `addr`.

parameterdescription.para: Address of the LUN to flush bad-block-table for
Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

briefdescription.para: Persist all bad-block-tables associated with the given `dev`.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned, `errno` set to indicate the error and ret filled with lower-level result codes

briefdescription.para: Allocate a copy of the given bad-block-table.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the bad-block-table to copy

simplesect.para: On success, a pointer to a write-able copy of the given bbt is returned. On error, NULL is returned and errno set to indicate the error

briefdescription.para: Destroys a given bad-block-table.
Prints a humanly readable representation of the given bad-block-table.
Prints a humanly readable representation of the given bad-block-table state.

simplesect.para: A handle to the device

briefdescription.para: Creates a handle to given device path.

parameterdescription.para: Path of the device to open e.g. "/dev/nvme0n1"
Flags for opening device in different modes

simplesect.para: A handle to the device

briefdescription.para: Destroys device-handle.
Prints misc.

detaileddescription.para: device attribute associated with the given handle

briefdescription.para: Prints all information about the device associated with the given handle.
Returns the file-descriptor associated with the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, file descriptor is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns the name associated with the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, string is returned. On error, NULL is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the path associated with the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, string is returned. On error, NULL is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the NVME namespace identifier of the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, NVME namespace identifier is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the verid of the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, verid is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns the media-controller capabilities mask of the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, capabilities mask is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns the default plane_mode of the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, pmode flag is returned

briefdescription.para: Set the default plane-mode for the given device.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Returns the mask of quirks for the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, quirk mask is returned

briefdescription.para: Set the default plane-mode for the given device.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Returns the ppa-format of the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, ppa-format is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns the ppa-format mask of the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, ppa-format mask is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns the 'meta-mode' of the given device.

simplesect.para: On success, meta-mode is returned

briefdescription.para: Set the default 'meta-mode' of the given device.

detaileddescription.para: The meta-mode is a setting used by the nvm_vblk interface to write pseudo-meta data to the out-of-bound area.

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum number of addresses to use when sending erases to device.
Returns whether caching is enabled for bad-block-tables on the device.

simplesect.para: 0 = cache disabled 1 = cache enabled

briefdescription.para: Returns the backend identifier associated with the given device.
Set the maximum number of addresses to use for reads, that is, when invoking nvm_addr_read.
Set the maximum number of addresses to use for writes, that is, when invoking nvm_addr_write.
Set the maximum number of addresses to use for erases, that is, when invoking nvm_addr_erase.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether retrieval and changes to bad-block-tables should be cached.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Set the maximum number of addresses to use for erases, that is, when invoking nvm_addr_erase.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Set the maximum number of addresses to use for erases, that is, when invoking nvm_addr_erase.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Returns the geometry of the given device.

simplesect.para: See struct nvm_geo for the specifics of the returned geometry
The geometry (struct nvm_geo) of given device handle

briefdescription.para: Allocate a buffer aligned to match the given geometry.

simplesect.para: nbytes must be greater than zero and a multiple of minimal granularity
Free the buffer using nvm_buf_free

parameterdescription.para: The geometry to get alignment information from
The size of the allocated buffer in bytes

simplesect.para: A pointer to the allocated memory. On error: NULL is returned and `errno` set appropriatly

briefdescription.para: Allocate a buffer of the given size with the given alignment.

simplesect.para: Free the buffer using nvm_buf_free

parameterdescription.para: The size of the buffer in bytes

simplesect.para: A pointer to the allocated memory. On error: NULL is returned and `errno` set appropriatly

briefdescription.para: Fills `buf` with chars A-Z.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the buffer to fill
Amount of bytes to fill in buf

briefdescription.para: Free the given buffer, calling regular "free" on the buffer might fail.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the buffer to fill
Amount of bytes to fill in buf

briefdescription.para: Prints `buf` to stdout.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the buffer to print
Amount of bytes of buf to print

briefdescription.para: Write content of buffer into file.

parameterdescription.para: Destination where buffer will be dumped to

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Read content of file into buffer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error and errno set to indicate the error.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, struct nvm_addr addrs[], int naddrs, uint16_t flags, struct nvm_ret *ret)
memberdef.name: nvm_addr_erase

briefdescription.para: Erase nvm at given addresses.

simplesect.para: The addresses given to this function are interpreted as block addresses, in contrast to `nvm_addr_mark`, `nvm_addr_write`, and `nvm_addr_read` for which the address is interpreted as a sector address.

parameterdescription.para: Length of array of memory addresses
Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result.

simplesect.para: 0 on success. On error: returns -1, sets `errno` accordingly, and fills `ret` with lower-level result and status codes

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, struct nvm_addr addrs[], int naddrs, const void *buf, const void *meta, uint16_t flags, struct nvm_ret *ret)
memberdef.name: nvm_addr_write

briefdescription.para: Write content of buf to nvm at address(es)

simplesect.para: The addresses given to this function are interpreted as sector addresses, in contrast to nvm_addr_mark and nvm_addr_erase for which the address is interpreted as a block address.

parameterdescription.para: Length of array of memory addresses
The buffer which content to write, must be aligned to device geometry of minimal write granularity and size equal to `naddrs * geo.nbytes`
Buffer containing metadata, must be of size equal to device `naddrs * geo.meta_nbytes`
Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result.

simplesect.para: 0 on success. On error: returns -1, sets `errno` accordingly, and fills `ret` with lower-level result and status codes

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, struct nvm_addr addrs[], int naddrs, void *buf, void *meta, uint16_t flags, struct nvm_ret *ret)
memberdef.name: nvm_addr_read

briefdescription.para: Read content of nvm at addresses into buf.

simplesect.para: The addresses given to this function are interpreted as sector addresses, in contrast to `nvm_addr_mark` and `nvm_addr_erase` for which the address is interpreted as a block address.

parameterdescription.para: Length of array of memory addresses
Buffer to store result of read into, must be aligned to device granularity min read and size equal to `naddrs * geo.sector_nbytes`
Buffer to store content of metadata, must be of size equal to device `naddrs * geo.meta_nbytes`
Pointer to structure in which to store lower-level status and result.

simplesect.para: 0 on success. On error: returns -1, sets `errno` accordingly, and fills `ret` with lower-level result and status codes

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the given address exceeds bounds of the given geometry.

parameterdescription.para: The geometric bounds to check the given address against

simplesect.para: A mask of exceeded boundaries

briefdescription.para: Converts a given physical address generic-format to device-format.

parameterdescription.para: The physical address on generic-format to convert

simplesect.para: Physical address on device-format

briefdescription.para: Converts a given physical address on device-format to generic-format.

parameterdescription.para: The physical address on device-format to convert

simplesect.para: Physical address on generic-format

briefdescription.para: Converts a given physical address on device-format to lba-format.

parameterdescription.para: The physical address on device-format to convert

simplesect.para: Physical address on lba-format

briefdescription.para: Converts a given physical address on device-format to lba-offset-format.

parameterdescription.para: The physical address on device-format to convert

simplesect.para: Physical address on lba-offset-format

briefdescription.para: Converts a given physical address on generic-format to byte offset.

parameterdescription.para: The physical address on generic-format to convert

simplesect.para: Logical address as byte offset

briefdescription.para: Converts a given byte offset to physical address on generic-format.

parameterdescription.para: Logical address as byte offset to convert

simplesect.para: Physical address on generic-format

briefdescription.para: Converts a given physical address on generic-format to LBA offset.

parameterdescription.para: The physical address on generic-format to convert

simplesect.para: Logical address as LBA offset

briefdescription.para: Converts a given LBA offset to physical address on generic-format.

parameterdescription.para: Logical address as LBA offset to convert

simplesect.para: Physical address on generic-format

briefdescription.para: Prints a humanly readable representation of the given address.
Prints a humanly readable representation of the given list of addresses.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, struct nvm_addr addrs[], int naddrs)
memberdef.name: nvm_vblk_alloc

briefdescription.para: Allocate a virtual block, spanning a given set of physical blocks.

parameterdescription.para: Set of block-addresses forming the virtual block
The number of addresses in the address-set

simplesect.para: On success, an opaque pointer to the initialized virtual block is returned. On error, NULL and `errno` set to indicate the error.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_dev *dev, int ch_bgn, int ch_end, int lun_bgn, int lun_end, int blk)
memberdef.name: nvm_vblk_alloc_line

briefdescription.para: Allocate a virtual block (spanning planes, channels, and LUNs)

parameterdescription.para: Beginning of the channel span, as inclusive index
End of the channel span, as inclusive index
Beginning of the LUN span, as inclusive index
End of the LUN span, as inclusive index

simplesect.para: On success, an opaque pointer to the initialized virtual block is returned. On error, NULL and `errno` set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a virtual block.
Erase a virtual block.

simplesect.para: Erasing a vblk will reset internal position pointers
On success, the number of bytes erased is returned. On error, -1 is returned and `errno` set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Write to a virtual block.

simplesect.para: buf must be aligned to device geometry, see struct nvm_geo and nvm_buf_alloc count must be a multiple of min-size, see struct nvm_geo do not mix use of nvm_vblk_pwrite with nvm_vblk_write on the same virtual block

parameterdescription.para: The virtual block to write to
The number of bytes to write

simplesect.para: On success, the number of bytes written is returned and vblk internal position is updated. On error, -1 is returned and `errno` set to indicate the error.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_vblk *vblk, const void *buf, size_t count, size_t offset)
memberdef.name: nvm_vblk_pwrite

briefdescription.para: Write to a virtual block at a given offset.

simplesect.para: buf must be aligned to device geometry, see struct nvm_geo and nvm_buf_alloc count must be a multiple of min-size, see struct nvm_geo offset must be a multiple of min-size, see struct nvm_geo do not mix use of nvm_vblk_pwrite with nvm_vblk_write on the same virtual block

parameterdescription.para: The virtual block to write to
The number of bytes to write
Start writing offset bytes within virtual block

simplesect.para: On success, the number of bytes written is returned. On error, -1 is returned and `errno` set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Pad the virtual block with synthetic data.

simplesect.para: Assumes that you have used nvm_vblk_write and now want to fill the remaining virtual block in order to meet block write-before-read constraints
On success, the number of bytes padded is returned and internal position is updated. On error, -1 is returned and `errno` set to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Read from a virtual block.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nvm_vblk *vblk, void *buf, size_t count, size_t offset)
memberdef.name: nvm_vblk_pread

briefdescription.para: Read from a virtual block at given offset.
Retrieve the device associated with the given virtual block.

parameterdescription.para: The entity to retrieve information from

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the set of addresses defining the virtual block.

parameterdescription.para: The entity to retrieve information from

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the number of addresses in the address set of the virtual block.

parameterdescription.para: The entity to retrieve information from

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the size, in bytes, of a given virtual block.

parameterdescription.para: The entity to retrieve information from

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the read cursor position for the given virtual block.

parameterdescription.para: The entity to retrieve information from

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the write cursor position for the given virtual block.

parameterdescription.para: The entity to retrieve information from

briefdescription.para: Set the read cursor position for the given virtual block.

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned and `errno` set to indicate the error

briefdescription.para: Set the write cursor position for the given virtual block.

simplesect.para: On success, 0 is returned. On error, -1 is returned and `errno` set to indicate the error

briefdescription.para: Print the virtual block in a humanly readable form.

parameterdescription.para: The entity to print information about
